title: Projectile motion - longer time and greater speed

content.description: Two identical balls <math alttext="A" overflow="scroll"><mi mathvariant="normal">A</mi></math> and <math alttext="B" overflow="scroll"> <mi mathvariant="normal">B</mi> </math> are launched from ground level at the same time. Each is launched with initial speed of <math alttext="50 meters per second" overflow="scroll"><mstyle displaystyle="true"><mtext>50</mtext><mspace width="0.2em"></mspace><mtext>m/s</mtext></mstyle></math> but at different angles, as shown in the figure.
content.question:
Which of the following correctly predicts which ball is in the air longer, and which ball has a greater speed at the maximum height?

Longer Time in Air
 Greater Speed at Highest Point

A
 Ball <math alttext="A" overflow="scroll"> <mi mathvariant="normal">A</mi> </math>
 Ball <math alttext="B" overflow="scroll"><mi mathvariant="normal">B</mi></math>

B
 Ball <math alttext="A" overflow="scroll"><mi mathvariant="normal">A</mi></math>
 Both Equal

C
 Ball <math alttext="B" overflow="scroll"><mi mathvariant="normal">B</mi></math>
 Ball <math alttext="B" overflow="scroll"><mi mathvariant="normal">B</mi></math>

D
 Ball <math alttext="B" overflow="scroll"><mi mathvariant="normal">B</mi></math>
 Both Equal

skill.text: 2.C: Compare physical quantities between two or more scenarios or at different times and locations in a single scenario.
